thread.title: ASUS ZenFone Live with real-time beautification and selfie flash launched
thread.title_full: ASUS ZenFone Live with real-time beautification and selfie flash launched

title: ASUS ZenFone Live with real-time beautification and selfie flash launched
text:
ASUS ZenFone Live with real-time beautification and selfie flash launched ASUS ZenFone Live with real-time beautification and selfie flash launched By February 24, 2017 “ASUS is claiming the ZenFone Live the world’s first smartphone with real-time beautification tech” 
The ASUS ZenFone 3 Go, which was leaked earlier this month, has been officially announced as the ZenFone Live. Targeted at selfie lovers, the ASUS ZenFone Live features a front-facing flash for brighter selfies under low-light conditions. The brand claims it to be the world’s first smartphone with hardware-optimised, real-time beautification technology. The device’s BeautyLive app lets you stream live through both cameras while applying a beautification filter on your face. 
The ASUS ZenFone Live features a 5-megapixel selfie shooter with f/2.2 aperture, autofocus, an LED flash, a low light mode and a manual mode. At the rear, it gets a 13-megapixel primary shooter with autofocus, an LED flash, f/2.0 aperture, a depth of field mode and a manual mode. The phone also features dual MEMS microphones to help eliminate background noise and enhance voice pickup. 
As for the other specs, the ASUS ZenFone Live features a 5-inch HD IPS display with ASUS TruVivid technology and bluelight filter. The smartphone is powered by a quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon processor (exact model not specified), mated to 2GB of RAM. The phone comes in 16GB and 32GB storage variants, and also gets a microSD card slot. Its other specs include Android Marshmallow, 4G LTE, dual-SIM slots, five magnet speakers and a 2,650mAh battery. 
The ASUS ZenFone Live also comes with 100GB of free storage on Google Drive for two years. There’s no word on the phone’s price or availability at the moment.
